description: From Late Latin sensualis (“endowed with feeling, sensual”), from Latin sensus (“feeling, sense”).

adjectives.description: sensual (comparative more sensual, superlative most sensual)

examples: That massage was a very sensual experience!

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to the physical senses; sensory.
examples: Plato believed that this sensual world in which we live is inferior to the heavenly realm.

entries.meaning: Provoking or exciting a strong response in the senses.
